body:
Stderr was [invented to convey messages to humans](http://minnie.tuhs.org/pipermail/tuhs/2013-December/002933.html), not machines. The machine-readable output should be sent to stdout so that it can be easily piped into another program or file.

In this case, if I'm running `go build -n` I expect the output to be a series of shell commands. Any errors that occur in producing that output should be sent to stderr.
